trans-unit.source: Base class for all validator components.
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] The Validator class is used to ensure that activities are configured properly at design time.

Validators are instantiated during design time when the designer validates the properties assigned to activities; if an activity's parameters are not configured properly, the designer will show smart tag errors for the incorrect values.
Validators also run during compile time, and will return validation errors if constraints such as object parent or child type, minimum number of children, etc. are not correct.
Validators will also run at runtime when a markup-based workflow is instantiated using the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime.CreateWorkflow%2A> method.
The main purpose of a Validator is to ensure that errors are known during design time, and are not exposed as exceptions during runtime.

Validators are associated with the activities that they validate using the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.ActivityValidatorAttribute.ValidatorTypeName%2A> attribute; all activity validators must inherit from the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.ActivityValidator> class.
By default, validators will validate meta properties; they do not validate instance properties which are settable at runtime.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.Validator"></xref> class.
Helper method to extract the full property name.
Useful when the validated property is nested.
The method traverses the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.PropertyValidationContext> in the stack to build the full name of the property.
For example: the name My.Actor.Bas is built using three <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.PropertyValidationContext> items.
If the validated property belongs to an object that is an item in a collection, the method will produce the name of the collection.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.ValidationManager"></xref> linked to the validation.
The full property name.
manager is .
Validates the specified object and returns a collection of validation errors.
The validation manager linked to the validation.
The <xref:System.Object> to be validated.
A <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.ValidationErrorCollection"></xref> that contains the validation errors resulting from this operation.
obj is a null reference ().
When overridden in a derived class, validates a change based on a specified <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> being added or removed.
This function is called during the application of changes that are made to the workflow during dynamic updates.
In the base implementation, a null reference (Visual Basic `Nothing`) is returned.
The specified <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref>.
The specified <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityChangeAction"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.ValidationError"></xref> generated by the operation.
action is a null reference ().
Helper method to automatically validate the specific objects properties.
The validation manager linked to the validation.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> to be validated.
A <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.ValidationErrorCollection"></xref> that contains the validation errors resulting from this operation.
obj is a null reference ().
Performs validation on a property and returns a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.ValidationErrorCollection"></xref> that contains the results of that validation.
If no errors result from the validation, an empty <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.ValidationErrorCollection> is returned.
The <xref:System.Reflection.PropertyInfo> on the subject property.
The owner of the property.
The value of the property.
A <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.ValidationManager"></xref> for this operation.
A <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.ValidationErrorCollection"></xref> that contains the results of that validation.
